understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method called prevalentSystem() which checks if the prevalent system is configured and throws an exception if it is not.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration as it is a method that ensures the prevalent system is properly configured before proceeding with other operations in the code.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration _prevalentSystem is used to initialize the prevalent system in the GenericSnapshotManager class. It is passed as a parameter when creating a new GenericSnapshotManager instance.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration _prevalentSystem is triggered whenever a new GenericSnapshotManager instance is created in the snapshotManager method. The frequency of triggering depends on how often the snapshotManager method is called.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _prevalentSystem configuration option on the system is significant as it is used to initialize the prevalent system in the GenericSnapshotManager. The choice of prevalent system can affect the behavior and performance of the system as a whole.
